page.title: 11INDUSTRY IN THE TADLEY AREA
page.content: Industry in Tadley has grown since the days when it was famous for its besom makers. The much deplored scrap yards are relics of the days when it was a gypsy community. The small industrial estates at Paices Hill and Stacey's Yard include the ubiquitous computer systems manufacturers; makers of portable buildings, laboratory equipment, windows and double glazing units, cement and aluminium, as well as plant and car hire firms; boiler maintenance and refrigeration engineers; printers; car repair firms; welders; and coal, bottled gas and timber merchants. There are carpet cleaners, caterers and commercial photographers. The Calleva Industrial Park is not yet fully operational but like the estates many of the units will be storage depots rather than actual manufacturing units.
